description: Represents a composite generator of noise gens

preprocessors.description:
preprocessors
Preprocess this object in-memory when it's loaded, run scripts using the variable 'Iris.getPreprocessorObject()' and modify properties about this object before it's used.
   
List<Script>

    
* Default Value is an empty list
* At least one entry must be defined, or just remove this list.
Must be a valid Script (use ctrl+space for auto complete!)

zoom.description:
zoom
The zoom or frequency.
   
Number

    
* Default Value is 1.0
* Minimum allowed is 0.001

opacity.description:
opacity
The opacity, essentially a multiplier on the output.
   
Number

    
* Default Value is 1.0
* Minimum allowed is 0.0

multiplicitive.description:
multiplicitive
Multiply the compsites instead of adding them
   
Boolean

    
* Default Value is a default object (create this object to see default properties)

cellFractureZoom.description:
cellFractureZoom
The size of the cell fractures
   
Number

    
* Default Value is 1.0
* Minimum allowed is 0.001

cellFractureShuffle.description:
cellFractureShuffle
Cell Fracture Coordinate Shuffling
   
Number

    
* Default Value is 12.0
* Minimum allowed is 0.0

cellFractureHeight.description:
cellFractureHeight
The height of fracture cells. Set to 0 to disable
   
Number

    
* Default Value is 0.0

cellPercentSize.description:
cellPercentSize
How big are the cells (X,Z) relative to the veins that touch them. Between 0 and 1. 0.1 means thick veins, small cells.
   
Number

    
* Default Value is 0.75
* Minimum allowed is 0.0
* Maximum allowed is 1.0

offsetX.description:
offsetX
The offset to shift this noise x
   
Number

    
* Default Value is 0.0

offsetZ.description:
offsetZ
The offset to shift this noise z
   
Number

    
* Default Value is 0.0

seed.description:
seed
The seed for this generator
   
Integer

    
* Default Value is 1

anyOf.description:
interpolator
The interpolator to use when smoothing this generator into other regions & generators
   
Interpolator (Object)
Configures rotation for iris
    
You can instead specify "snippet/interpolator/some-name.json" to use a snippet file instead of specifying it here.
    
* Default Value is a default object (create this object to see default properties)

interpolator.description:
interpolator
The interpolator to use when smoothing this generator into other regions & generators
   
Interpolator (Object)
Configures rotation for iris
    
You can instead specify "snippet/interpolator/some-name.json" to use a snippet file instead of specifying it here.
    
* Default Value is a default object (create this object to see default properties)

cliffHeightMax.description:
cliffHeightMax
Cliff Height Max. Disable with 0 for min and max
   
Number

    
* Default Value is 0.0
* Minimum allowed is 0.0
* Maximum allowed is 8192.0

cliffHeightMin.description:
cliffHeightMin
Cliff Height Min. Disable with 0 for min and max
   
Number

    
* Default Value is 0.0
* Minimum allowed is 0.0
* Maximum allowed is 8192.0

composite.description:
composite
The list of noise gens this gen contains.
   
List of NoiseGenerators (Objects)

    
* Default Value is an empty list
* At least one entry must be defined, or just remove this list.

anyOf.description:
cliffHeightGenerator
The noise gen for cliff height.
   
NoiseGenerator (Object)
A noise generator
    
You can instead specify "snippet/generator/some-name.json" to use a snippet file instead of specifying it here.
    
* Default Value is a default object (create this object to see default properties)

cliffHeightGenerator.description:
cliffHeightGenerator
The noise gen for cliff height.
   
NoiseGenerator (Object)
A noise generator
    
You can instead specify "snippet/generator/some-name.json" to use a snippet file instead of specifying it here.
    
* Default Value is a default object (create this object to see default properties)

zoom.description:
zoom
The coordinate input zoom
   
Number

    
* Default Value is 1.0
* Minimum allowed is 1.0E-4

negative.description:
negative
Reverse the output. So that noise = -noise + opacity
   
Boolean

    
* Default Value is a default object (create this object to see default properties)

opacity.description:
opacity
The output multiplier
   
Number

    
* Default Value is 1.0
* Minimum allowed is 0.0
* Maximum allowed is 1.0

offsetX.description:
offsetX
Coordinate offset x
   
Number

    
* Default Value is 0.0

offsetY.description:
offsetY
Height output offset y. Avoid using with terrain generation.
   
Number

    
* Default Value is 0.0

offsetZ.description:
offsetZ
Coordinate offset z
   
Number

    
* Default Value is 0.0

seed.description:
seed
The seed
   
Integer

    
* Default Value is 0

parametric.description:
parametric
Apply a parametric curve on the output
   
Boolean

    
* Default Value is a default object (create this object to see default properties)

bezier.description:
bezier
Apply a bezier curve on the output
   
Boolean

    
* Default Value is a default object (create this object to see default properties)

sinCentered.description:
sinCentered
Apply a sin-center curve on the output (0, and 1 = 0 and 0.5 = 1.0 using a sinoid shape.)
   
Boolean

    
* Default Value is a default object (create this object to see default properties)

exponent.description:
exponent
The exponent noise^EXPONENT
   
Number

    
* Default Value is 1.0

enabled.description:
enabled
Enable / disable. Outputs offsetY if disabled
   
Boolean

    
* Default Value is a default object (create this object to see default properties)

anyOf.description:
style
The Noise Style
   
GeneratorStyle (Object)
A gen style
    
You can instead specify "snippet/style/some-name.json" to use a snippet file instead of specifying it here.
    
* Default Value is a default object (create this object to see default properties)

style.description:
style
The Noise Style
   
GeneratorStyle (Object)
A gen style
    
You can instead specify "snippet/style/some-name.json" to use a snippet file instead of specifying it here.
    
* Default Value is a default object (create this object to see default properties)

octaves.description:
octaves
Multiple octaves for multple generators of changing zooms added together
   
Integer

    
* Default Value is 1
* Minimum allowed is 1

fracture.description:
fracture
Apply a child noise generator to fracture the input coordinates of this generator
   
List of NoiseGenerators (Objects)

    
* Default Value is an empty list
* At least one entry must be defined, or just remove this list.

function.description:
function
The interpolation method when two biomes use different heights but this same generator
   
InterpolationMethod
An interpolation method (or function) is simply a method of smoothing a position based on surrounding points on a grid. Bicubic for example is smoother, but has 4 times the checks than Bilinear for example. Try using BILINEAR_STARCAST_9 for beautiful results.
    
* Default Value is a default object (create this object to see default properties)
Must be a valid InterpolationMethod (use ctrl+space for auto complete!)

horizontalScale.description:
horizontalScale
The range checked horizontally. Smaller ranges yeild more detail but are not as smooth.
   
Number

    
* Default Value is 7.0
* Minimum allowed is 1.0
* Maximum allowed is 8192.0

Inverse of vascular, height gets to 1.0 as it approaches the center of a cell
Inverse of vascular, height gets to 1.0 as it approaches the center of a cell, using the iris style.

Vascular noise gets higher as the position nears a cell border. Cells are distorted using Iris styled wispy noise.
Vascular noise gets higher as the position nears a cell border. Cells are distorted using Iris styled wispy noise.
Vascular noise gets higher as the position nears a cell border. Cells are distorted using Iris styled wispy noise.
Vascular noise gets higher as the position nears a cell border. Cells are distorted using Iris styled wispy noise.
No interpolation. Nearest Neighbor (bad for terrain, great for performance).
Uses 4 nearby points in a square to calculate a 2d slope. Very fast but creates square artifacts. See: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bilinear_interpolation

Starcast is Iris's own creation. It uses raytrace checks to find a horizontal boundary nearby. 3 Checks in a circle. Typically starcast is used with another interpolation method. See BILINEAR_STARCAST_9 For example. Starcast is meant to 'break up' large, abrupt cliffs to make cheap interpolation smoother.

Starcast is Iris's own creation. It uses raytrace checks to find a horizontal boundary nearby. 6 Checks in a circle. Typically starcast is used with another interpolation method. See BILINEAR_STARCAST_9 For example. Starcast is meant to 'break up' large, abrupt cliffs to make cheap interpolation smoother.

Starcast is Iris's own creation. It uses raytrace checks to find a horizontal boundary nearby. 9 Checks in a circle. Typically starcast is used with another interpolation method. See BILINEAR_STARCAST_9 For example. Starcast is meant to 'break up' large, abrupt cliffs to make cheap interpolation smoother.

Starcast is Iris's own creation. It uses raytrace checks to find a horizontal boundary nearby. 12 Checks in a circle. Typically starcast is used with another interpolation method. See BILINEAR_STARCAST_9 For example. Starcast is meant to 'break up' large, abrupt cliffs to make cheap interpolation smoother.
Uses starcast to break up the abrupt sharp cliffs, then smooths the rest out with bilinear.
Uses starcast to break up the abrupt sharp cliffs, then smooths the rest out with bilinear.
Uses starcast to break up the abrupt sharp cliffs, then smooths the rest out with bilinear.
Uses starcast to break up the abrupt sharp cliffs, then smooths the rest out with bilinear.
Uses starcast to break up the abrupt sharp cliffs, then smooths the rest out with hermite.
Uses starcast to break up the abrupt sharp cliffs, then smooths the rest out with hermite.
Uses starcast to break up the abrupt sharp cliffs, then smooths the rest out with hermite.
Uses starcast to break up the abrupt sharp cliffs, then smooths the rest out with hermite.
Uses bilinear but on a bezier curve. See: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bezier_curve
Uses Bilinear but with parametric curves alpha 2.
Uses Bilinear but with parametric curves alpha 4.
Uses Bilinear but with parametric curves alpha 1.5.
Bicubic noise creates 4, 4-point splines for a total of 16 checks. Bcubic can go higher than expected and lower than expected right before a large change in slope.
Hermite is similar to bicubic, but faster and it can be tuned a little bit
Essentially bicubic with zero tension
Essentially bicubic with max tension
Hermite is similar to bicubic, this variant reduces the dimple artifacts of bicubic
Hermite is similar to bicubic, this variant reduces the dimple artifacts of bicubic
Hermite is similar to bicubic, this variant reduces the dimple artifacts of bicubic

style.description:
style
The chance is 1 in CHANCE per interval
   
NoiseStyle
Styles of noise
    
* Default Value is a default object (create this object to see default properties)
Must be a valid NoiseStyle (use ctrl+space for auto complete!)

zoom.description:
zoom
The zoom of this style
   
Number

    
* Default Value is 1.0
* Minimum allowed is 1.0E-5

expression.description:
expression
Instead of using the style property, use a custom expression to represent this style.
   
Iris Expression

Must be a valid expressions (use ctrl+space for auto complete!)

multiplier.description:
multiplier
The Output multiplier. Only used if parent is fracture.
   
Number

    
* Default Value is 1.0
* Minimum allowed is 1.0E-5

axialFracturing.description:
axialFracturing
If set to true, each dimension will be fractured with a different order of input coordinates. This is usually 2 or 3 times slower than normal.
   
Boolean

    
* Default Value is a default object (create this object to see default properties)

anyOf.description:
fracture
Apply a generator to the coordinate field fed into this parent generator. I.e. Distort your generator with another generator.
   
GeneratorStyle (Object)
A gen style
    
You can instead specify "snippet/style/some-name.json" to use a snippet file instead of specifying it here.

fracture.description:
fracture
Apply a generator to the coordinate field fed into this parent generator. I.e. Distort your generator with another generator.
   
GeneratorStyle (Object)
A gen style
    
You can instead specify "snippet/style/some-name.json" to use a snippet file instead of specifying it here.

exponent.description:
exponent
The exponent
   
Number

    
* Default Value is 1.0
* Minimum allowed is 0.01562
* Maximum allowed is 64.0
